content.heading: Keyboard Shortcuts for Windows and Mac
paragraphs: Keyboard shortcuts enhance efficiency in modern operating systems and software.
Learning shortcuts can save significant time.

content.heading: Basic Shortcuts
paragraphs: 1. Edit menu: Alt + E / Ctrl + F2 + F
2. File menu: Alt + F / Ctrl + F2 + E
3. View menu: Alt + V / Ctrl + F2 + V
4. Select all text: Ctrl + A / Cmd + A
5. Copy text: Ctrl + C / Cmd + C
6. Find text: Ctrl + F / Cmd + F
7. Find and replace text: Ctrl + H / Cmd + F
8. New document: Ctrl + N / Cmd + N
9. Open a file: Ctrl + O / Cmd + O
10. Print options: Ctrl + P / Cmd + P
11. Save file: Ctrl + S / Cmd + S
12. Paste text: Ctrl + V / Cmd + V
13. Cut text: Ctrl + X / Cmd + X
14. Redo text: Ctrl + Y / Shift + Cmd + Z
15. Undo text: Ctrl + Z / Cmd + Z

content.heading: Text Editing
paragraphs: 1. Go to the right or start of next line: Right Arrow / Right Arrow
2. Go to the left or end of previous line: Left Arrow / Left Arrow
3. Go up one row: Up Arrow / Up Arrow
4. Go down one row: Down Arrow / Down Arrow
5. Go to start of current line: Home / Cmd + Left Arrow
6. Go to end of current line: End / Cmd + Right Arrow
7. Go to start of document: Ctrl + Home / Cmd + Up Arrow
8. Go to end of document: Ctrl + End / Cmd + Down Arrow
9. Move up one frame: Page Up / Fn + Up Arrow
10. Move down one frame: Page Down / Fn + Down Arrow
11. Go to start of previous word: Ctrl + Left Arrow / Option + Left Arrow
12. Go to start of next word: Ctrl + Right Arrow / Option + Right Arrow
13. Go to start of line break: Ctrl + Up Arrow / Cmd + Left Arrow
14. Go to end of line break: Ctrl + Down Arrow / Cmd + Right Arrow
15. Select characters to the left: Shift + Left Arrow / Shift + Left Arrow
16. Select characters to the right: Shift + Right Arrow / Shift + Right Arrow
17. Select lines upwards: Shift + Up Arrow / Shift + Up Arrow
18. Select lines downwards: Shift + Down Arrow / Shift + Down Arrow
19. Select words to the left: Shift + Ctrl + Left / Shift + Opt + Left
20. Select words to the right: Shift + Ctrl + Right / Shift + Opt + Right
21. Select paragraphs to the left: Shift + Ctrl + Up / Shift + Opt + Up
22. Select paragraphs to the right: Shift + Ctrl + Down / Shift + Opt + Down
23. Select to start of current line: Shift + Home / Cmd + Shift + Left Arrow
24. Select to end of current line: Shift + End / Cmd + Shift + Right Arrow
25. Select to start of document: Shift + Ctrl + Home / Cmd + Shift + Up Arrow
26. Select to end of document: Shift + Ctrl + End / Cmd + Shift + Down Arrow
27. Select frame above cursor: Shift + Page Up / Shift + Fn + Up Arrow
28. Select frame below cursor: Shift + Page Down / Shift + Fn + Down Arrow
29. Select all text: Ctrl + A / Cmd + A
30. Find text: Ctrl + F / Cmd + F
31. Make selected text bold: Ctrl + B / Cmd + B
32. Make selected text italic: Ctrl + I / Cmd + I
33. Underline selected text: Ctrl + U / Cmd + U
34. Make selected text superscript: Ctrl + Shift + = / Cmd + Shift + =
35. Make selected text subscript: Ctrl + = / Cmd + =
36. Delete characters to the left: Backspace / Backspace
37. Delete characters to the right: Delete / Fn + Backspace
38. Delete words to the right: Ctrl + Del / Cmd + Backspace
39. Delete words to the left: Ctrl + Backspace / Cmd + Fn + Backspace
40. Indent: Tab / Tab
41. Outdent: Shift + Tab / Shift + Tab

content.heading: Web Browsers
paragraphs: 1. Scroll down a frame: Space or Page Down / Space or Fn + Down Arrow
2. Scroll up a frame: Shift + Space or Page Up / Shift + Space or Fn + Up Arrow
3. Go to bottom of page: End / Cmd + Down Arrow
4. Go to top of page: Home / Cmd + Up Arrow
5. Go back: Alt + Left Arrow or Backspace / Cmd + Left Arrow
6. Go forward: Alt + Right Arrow or Shift + Backspace / Cmd + Right Arrow
7. Refresh a webpage: F5 / Cmd + R
8. Refresh (no cache): Ctrl + F5 / Cmd + Shift + R
9. Stop: Esc / Esc
10. Toggle full-screen: F11 / Cmd + Shift + F
11. Zoom in: Ctrl + + / Cmd + +
12. Zoom out: Ctrl + - / Cmd + -
13. Zoom 100% (default): Ctrl + 0 / Cmd + 0
14. Open homepage: Alt + Home / Option + Home or Option + Fn + Left Arrow
15. Find text: Ctrl + F / Cmd + F
16. Open a new tab: Ctrl + T / Cmd + T
17. Close current tab: Ctrl + W / Cmd + W
18. Close all tabs: Ctrl + Shift + W / Cmd + Q
19. Close all tabs except current: Ctrl + Alt + F4 / Cmd + Opt + W
20. Go to next tab: Ctrl + Tab / Control + Tab or Cmd + Shift + Right Arrow
21. Go to previous tab: Ctrl + Shift + Tab / Shift + Control + Tab or Cmd + Shift + Left Arrow
22. Go to specific tab number: Ctrl + 1-8 / Cmd + 1-8
23. Go to last tab: Ctrl + 9 / Cmd + 9
24. Reopen last closed tab: Ctrl + Shift + T / Cmd + Shift + T
25. Open a new window: Ctrl + N / Cmd + N
26. Close current window: Alt + F4 / Cmd + W
27. Go to next window: Alt + Tab / Cmd + Tab
28. Go to previous window: Alt + Shift + Tab / Cmd + Shift + Tab
29. Reopen last closed window: Ctrl + Shift + N / None
30. Open link in new tab (background): Ctrl + Click / Cmd + Click
31. Open link in new tab (foreground): Ctrl + Shift + Click / Cmd + Shift + Click
32. Print current webpage: Ctrl + P / Cmd + P
33. Save current webpage: Ctrl + S / Cmd + S
34. Cycle between toolbar, search, and page elements: Tab / Tab
35. Go to browser's address bar: Ctrl + L or Alt + D / Cmd + L
36. Focus and select browser's search bar: Ctrl + E / Cmd + E or Cmd + K
37. Open address bar location in new tab: Alt + Enter / Opt + Enter
38. Display list of previously typed addresses: F4 / None
39. Add 'www.' and '.com' to address bar text: Ctrl + Enter / Cmd + Enter or Control + Enter
40. Open bookmarks menu: Ctrl + B / Cmd + B
41. Add bookmark for current page: Ctrl + D / Cmd + Opt + B or Cmd + Shift + B
42. Open browsing history: Ctrl + H / Cmd + Shift + H or Cmd + Y
43. Open download history: Ctrl + J / Cmd + J or Cmd + Shift + J
